_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 16:51:10 using v2.1
title: How have waiting times for cancer treatment changed?
analysis_commentary:
There are three main types of treatments for cancer: drug therapy; surgery; radiotherapy. It is common for cancer patients to need more than one cancer treatment, which could be a combination of several of one type or a combination of multiple types.

For all cancer treatment types, the proportion of people receiving their first treatment within 31 days was consistently high at 98.0% or over. The operational standard for this measure is that this is met for 96% of people, we can see that this standard was exceeded in every quarter up to the end of 2013.
